result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquell Laquon Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquell Laquon Johnson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant has not hired an attorney yet.  Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department:
9/24/22.    22RM044510

Cash bail bond previously posted to be returned to remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TDC.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Marquell Laquon Johnson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
